episodes.title: 139. Mummified Rizz
episodes.description: Jake tells Dusti the bizarre and sad story about the Kaneko family. This episode devolves a lot and they end up talking about a mocktail bar in Rexburg, ID. It has virgin margaritas and mummified corpses. What more could you ask for? It's seriously as chaotic as it sounds. Note: This episode mentions eating disorders. Listen with caution.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 138. Mormon Missionary Lore
episodes.description: This week, Jake and Dusti talk about the weird, funny, and cringey folklore specific to Mormon missionaries. Did sister missionaries actually fill their gas tank with water? Is every mission being infiltrated by the Twelve Apostates? Listen and find out!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 137. Rameumptom? More Like Ram Me Up Him
episodes.description: Jake gives Dusti a lesson straight from the Mormon lesson manual about Alma, Korihor, the Zoramites, and a funny little thing called the Rameumptom. This isn't your Mom's Sunday School lesson though. Jake has added a little twist to it. Listen to find out!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 136. What are your Favorite Sins?
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti get tipsy and read an article from the Liahona about favorite sins. According to Mormons, the only valid reason to leave the church is because you want to sin. It couldn't be because it's a cult with problematic doctrine and history.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 135. Anticipatory Grief
episodes.description: This week's episode focuses on anticipatory grief and, really, grief in general. Jake and Dusti compare an article in LDS Living to the advice given in an article by Forbes. There are some heavier elements in this episode, so listen with that in mind. Note: Jake and Dusti are not mental health professionals. For more guidance in grief, please seek the assistance of a licensed professional.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 134. The Glad Game
episodes.description: Positive psychology focuses on how we can use our strengths and positive experiences to help us cope. It can be a beneficial tool when navigating loss of faith and deconstruction. This is not Pollyanna or the Glad Game, but something that you can learn more about when going to a therapist. Note: We are not professionals. Opinions in this episode and all other episodes are from our personal experience and research. Please seek the help of a trained professional for more guidance.
subjects: Psychology

episodes.title: 133. The Church with No Name
episodes.description: Jake has finally found something that Dusti didn't know about! It's not a huge deal because very few people know about this very secretive cult known as the Two by Twos. It has been covered by 60 Minutes but people still don't know very much about them. Please listen with caution as child sex abuse is mentioned in this episode.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 132. The First Pride was a Riot
episodes.description: To end Pride Month, Jake and Dusti go on a deep dive into the history of Pride. Hint: it started way before Stonewall. Hope everyone has had a safe and fun Pride Month!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 131. What it Means to be Transgender
episodes.description: A lot of people still have misconceptions about transgender people. Jake and Dusti talk about some myths and how to debunk them when faced with it.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 130. Your MOM is Embarrassing
episodes.description: Pride Month Continues! Jake and Dusti discuss mixed-orientation marriages where gay men and women enter into straight-passing relationships because their religion told them that was what God wanted. Even though the church has moved away from promoting this, it is still very prevalent among members today.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 129. It's Giving 2SLGBTQIA+
episodes.description: Have you ever wondered what it means to be Two-Spirit? Or what the term non-binary actually encompasses? Dusti and Jake go through several of the terms in the 2SLGBTQIA+ community to help you understand it more not only just for Pride Month, but also to help throughout any time! Happy Pride Month, besties!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 128. Servicing the Savior
episodes.description: Oh hey there was another worldwide devotional geared toward young single adults in the church held on May 5, 2024. Oh hey, nothing really new was said. They still want the YSAs to just do what they're told. Jake and Dusti are still going to discuss it!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 127. Get Your MRS Degree
episodes.description: If you've been on social media the past week, you've most likely seen commentary on Chief's kicker, Harrison Butker, and his viral commencement speech. Jake and Dusti take a deep dive into what he said and how it parallels with things that are said in Mormon churches and at General Conference.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 126. Is That a 200ft Spire in Your Pocket, or Are You Just Happy to See Me?
episodes.description: Ready for an update on the drama surrounding temple building in different areas of the world? Jake gives an update on the Cody Wyoming and Heber City Utah temple construction. Dusti gives an update about a new Vegas temple. Also, is there really going to be a temple in China?
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 125. Two Sides One Coin
episodes.description: On this week's episode, Dusti tells Jake all about the world of tradwife Mormon content creators. They also talk about the similarities between Mormon and exMormon influencers.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 124. City of 800,000 Men
episodes.description: Cain is Big Foot? Three Nephites fixing tires? A whole city raised up into heaven? Mormon lore is some of the most bizarre stuff. This episode Jake tells Dusti about a more obscure story about the City of Enoch and one of the main Mormon beliefs about it.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 123. Foreordained Foreskin
episodes.description: This is the second half of a two-parter where Jake reads another General Conference talk to Dusti. This one is from another crusty dusty from the Seventy, Elder Bangerter, who talks to the youth of the church about being foreordained and oh so privileged.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 122. Sure, J. Ann
episodes.description: Apparently Mormon God really cares about your underwear. Mormon leaders are really harping on wearing garments more so than usual. Listen as Dusti reads that infamous talk by J. Annette Dennis from the April 2024 General Conference.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 121. Narcissistic Abuse & the Church
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti welcome special guest, Becky, to the podcast to talk about narcissistic abuse behavior and how it relates to the church. This one is a banger you won't want to miss! More information can be found at intothefirelight.com.
subjects: Psychology

episodes.title: 120. Indigenous Peoples & FamilySearch
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti talk about the church's nonprofit, FamilySearch, which is a huge database that is used worldwide by members and nonmembers for genealogical research. But how does this fit in with the Indigenous People and their history?
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 119. Hear Her
episodes.description: This week Jake and Dusti discuss the now-infamous Instagram post on the Church's account that said "no other religious organization...has so broadly given power and authority to women." This post has caused quite a stir among both Mormons and exMormons.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 118. Praise to the Criminal
episodes.description: Dusti tells Jake about all of the things we weren't taught about Joseph Smith while in the church. Hint: he was a con-man and a criminal!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 117. They Have Clocks in Canada
episodes.description: This week Jake and Dusti read a talk given at BYU by Elder Wilford W Andersen about the pride cycle. They talk about what it means to be prideful and how the church's messaging around pride is harmful. They compare this with what psychologists say about pride. And of course there's plenty of metaphors to go around!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 116. Reconstructing Self Love
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti finish off the month of love with a discussion about self-love. They compare Psychology Today's version of self-love to the Mormon church's version. There is a small digression into parenting as well. This one is a lighthearted episode!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
Psychology

episodes.title: 115. Twin Flames Universe
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake discuss the wild story of the Twin Flames Universe. Two online gurus claim to be able to assign people their "twin flame" all while charging them exorbitant amounts of money, encouraging stalking behaviors, and also forced gender reassignment. TW: anti-trans, suicide, miscarriage
subjects: Twin Flames Universe

episodes.title: 114. Love Bombing
episodes.description: The season of love continues as Jake and Dusti discuss love bombing, a tactic used by cults, narcissists, predators, and abusers to manipulate. Please note that Jake and Dusti are speaking from experience and research and are not not nor claim to be professionals. If you are experiencing this type of abuse or have experienced it, please seek the help of a professional. TWs: emotional abuse, domestic abuse
subjects: Psychology

episodes.title: 113. Pay Attention to the Doorbell
episodes.description: It's the Month of Love! And Jake and Dusti are here to read yet another chapter from Laura Brotherson's Mormon sex book, And They Were Not Ashamed. This portion talks about sexual differences and compatibility. This one definitely contains explicit content so make sure innocent ears can't hear!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 112. Dance, Puppet, Dance!
episodes.description: Dusti tells Jake about the new Communications Manager for the Mormon church, Aaron Sherinian, who has personal views that don't necessarily align with church doctrine. This leads into discussion about the last church historian hired by the church, Leonard Arrington, and how the church loves to spin and will only keep you around if you dance like a puppet for them.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 111. From McDonald's to Mother God
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti talk about the spiritual leader, Amy Carlson, who went from McDonald's manager to a cult leader in a short amount of time. This episode is based on the HBO documentary Love Has Won.
subjects: Love Has Won

episodes.title: 110. Mormonese
episodes.description: Dusti tells Jake all about a ministry geared specifically toward testifying to Mormons called Truth in Love. This group from Nampa, ID has all the materials you need to talk to your Mormon friends to save them from their cult and testify of Jesus!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 109. Touched by His Noodly Appendages
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake are back! The first episode of 2024 is a saucy treat as the duo talks about the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster. Don't be upsetti, eat some spaghetti! You won't want to miss this episode all about a carbohydrate monster who created the universe. R'Amen!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 108. Skyr Gobblers and Sausage Swipers
episodes.description: Lo Saturnalia! Join Jake and Dusti as they discuss holiday traditions that are not Christian as well as some history lessons about ancient Rome. Happy Holidays, ya Bowl Lickers!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 107. Get Yo Drank On
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake swap holiday adult beverage recipes and give tips to listeners who may be new to the alcoholic beverage world! We also fully support sobriety and other reasons anyone may choose not to drink!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 106. Light My World
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake talk about the big marketing promotion from the Mormons, Light the World. Is the church transparent about where the money goes? They also discuss how these curated experiences effect the holiday spirit.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 105. Irish Goodbye
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake discuss reasons why people leave the Mormon church. Of course there are a few tangents and other topics along the way. Join us for a more relaxed episode!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 104. I Don't Know Her
episodes.description: Jake gives Dusti an American history lesson! This one is timely for several reasons: American Thanksgiving, Israel, and the Ballards. This talk has been scrubbed from BYU-I and the church's website, so listen to find out what they want to keep hidden!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 103. Sweet Baby Ruth
episodes.description: Jake forces Dusti to participate in a seminary lesson from the Old Testament about the book of Ruth. The things she endures as Jake's emotional support Canadian know no limits.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 102. Dilly Dally Soaks
episodes.description: It's that time of year again! Dusti and Jake cover two talks as a highlight reel from October 2023 General Conference. They cover Dallin H Oaks' Kingdoms of Glory talk and Gary Stevenson's Promptings of the Spirit talk. Not So Molly Mormon is covering two more talks, so head on over there to listen if you just can't get enough!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 101. Skeet Skeet, Demons!
episodes.description: Things get a bit spooky, dramatic, and somewhat homoerotic as Dusti tells Jake five scary stories from Mormon history. There's an exorcism, some light choking, and a lot of men being tossed about. Buckle in for a Halloween scare and some laughs!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 100. Who the F**k is Mary Whitmer?
episodes.description: Join us for our special 100th episode! For this milestone, Dusti and Kadey go head-to-head in a round of ExMo Jeopardy! See how well you'd do answering these questions!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 99. Arbitrary and Capricious
episodes.description: Cody, Wyoming and Heber City, Utah are two cities where the Mormon church is trying to build temples. The citizens of those towns have shown they don't want the temples yet the church is elbowing their way in. Even to the detriment of those towns. Listen as Jake tells Dusti all the details!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 98. Celine Dion Wants to Adopt Me: Coco Berthmann's Story
episodes.description: Dusti takes Jake on a deep dive into the wild story of Coco Berthmann, a con-woman who has ties to Tim Ballard, Celine Dion (supposedly), Oprah (allegedly), and the LDS church (legitimately). TW: child abuse. Rate, review, & subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
Human Trafficking

episodes.title: 97. Spiritual Pickles
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti were guests on sister podcast, Not So Molly Mormon. Kadey reads a talk given by Elder Bednar with a ridiculous analogy. That's the only description you get! Rate, review, and subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 96. BYU-ty Shorts
episodes.description: The Church Educational System (CES) updated the Honor Code for the BYUs. One update is humorous because it's about shorts. The other is not so humorous because it's very harmful to LGBTQ+ students who attend the church schools. Jake and Dusti are here to tell you all about it! Rate, review, & subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 95. Effects of Abuse
episodes.description: Jake reads two different talks by Richard G Scott that cover abuse. Spoiler alert: the church's view on abuse is very problematic. Jake and Dusti also digress about the church's latest Google maps rebrand, finding a good therapist, and Emperor's New Groove. TW: sexual abuse
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 94. Mormon Mistress
episodes.description: Jake tells Dusti about Holly Jane, a Mormon mom who got excommunicated for her OnlyFans bikini photos. They briefly digress about softcore porn because...why not?! Rate, review, and subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 93. Poppin Temple Cherries
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake tell their stories about the first time they went through the temple. Listen with care: this one might trigger listeners who have had trauma tied to going to the temple.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 92. The 1st Rule of Second Anointing is Don't Talk about Second Anointing
episodes.description: This week Jake and Dusti chat about a super-secret, upper echelon, culty ordinance in the church called the Second Anointing. Not much is known about it because no one is supposed to talk about it! Listen to learn all about it! Rate, review, & subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Special Episode: Combined Activity
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti were on Not So Molly Mormon podcast with Kadey for a combined activity! Kadey gives a Combined Activity lesson meant for young adults in the church. Rate, review, & subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 91. Putting the Wand in the Chamber of Secrets
episodes.description: Dr. Laura Brotherson is back! Not as a guest, but her book And They Were Not Ashamed is back on the show, and this week Jake and Dusti talk all about "the female symphony" aka the female orgasm. Warning: don't play a drinking game for every time they say the word "clitoris" as it WILL lead to alcohol poisoning! Rate, review, and subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 90. Phantom Pigeons
episodes.description: As Not So Peter Priesthood podcast turns 2 years old, Jake, Dusti, and Kadey dive into the occult. It starts out with a woman named Marjorie Cameron and ends with how Aleister Crowley was influenced by none other than J Dawg himself! Things get very weird! TW: attempted suicide, abortion
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
Ordo Templi Orientis

episodes.title: 89. DezNasty
episodes.description: This episode is all about the Chads of the Mormon world, DezNat (no offense to listeners named Chad). Everything you didn't want to know about this social media movement among extremist Mormons. Rate, review, and subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 88. Drink Your Juice, Sheri
episodes.description: This week, Jake reads a talk given by Sheri Dew about how prophets can see around corners. Along the way, Jake and Dusti talk about old flip phones, Gandalf (naturally), Mormon persecution complex, and the problems with personal revelation. Rate, review, and subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 87. Family Watch International
episodes.description: To end Pride Month this year, Jake tells Dusti about an international organization led by a Mormon woman and her husband that is pushing for anti-gay laws and education in Africa. Family Watch International is leading the charge in several countries in Africa to promote the eradication of LGBTQ+ individuals. Note: this is NOT an Anti-Blippi podcast. Dusti just has a lot of feelings. TW: abortion, anti-LGBTQ topics, HIV/AIDS
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 86. Uncommon Common Ground
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake discuss the Deseret News article written by out, gay, LDS, former BYU mascot Charlie Bird who just got engaged to his fiancé. It's an article about finding a common ground for LGBTQ+ individuals and the Mormon faith. Jake also tells Dusti about the drama in Rexburg around the Pride celebration. There's also a huge digression about cloacas. Rate, review, and subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 85. We're Here and We're Queer
episodes.description: Continuing this Pride Month, Dusti tells Jake about some gay-straight alliances with Mormon ties. They discuss the need for alliances and how these groups impact church membership. Rate, review, and subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 84. Dallin Homophobe Oaks Strikes Again
episodes.description: To kick off Pride month, Jake and Dusti read a devotional given by Dallin and June Oaks. He is being praised by some as being more progressive in this, but it's very clear, very fast, that he's still up to his old tricks. Digressions ensue, of course. Rate, review, and subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 83. Down with the Oneness
episodes.description: Let's talk about (Mormon) sex! Again! Take another uncomfortable dive into Dr. Laura Brotherson's And They Were Not Ashamed. Jake and Dusti talk dragon sex (of course), putting gas in the tank, role-play, a smidgeon of Bridgerton, and about how some Mormons pray before sex. Rate, review, subscribe wherever you listen to podcasts!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 82. Hate Us cuz You Ain't Us
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti talk about a BYU professor who shared with her class that her daughter was transgender. The Cougar Chronicle reported on it in a very disgusting and ignorant way as you can imagine. This conversation also segues into how the Family Proclamation came to be. Follow us: notsopeterpriesthood on Instagram. Email us: notsopeterpriesthood@gmail.com
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 81. The General Authorities Poop Too
episodes.description: Dusti, Jake, and Kadey (from Not So Molly Mormon podcast) cover the April 2023 General Conference. It starts and ends with poop talk, but they also talk parenting, peace, and fortune-telling (patriarchal blessings). Enjoy these highlights! We read them so you wouldn't have to!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 80. Can't with the Truck Nuts
episodes.description: Dusti is back! This is a short episode to welcome back the emotional support Canadian and for you to hear basically what a real conversation between Jake and Dusti is like. They talk online dating, trucks, vitamins, Jared Leto, and weak pullout games. Dusti apologizes to all listeners for leaving them with Jake, but the sassy Canadian is back. More screaming into the void to come!
subjects: Jared Leto

episodes.title: 79. Irene's Entropy: The Testimony Tour
episodes.description: Jake welcomes back Irene from Irene's Entropy to the podcast to talk about her latest single, an upcoming tour, and details about her new album coming out next year. You can listen to her latest single, Persephone II, on all streaming platforms and also see the music video!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 78. Spring Chicken
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti welcome special guest Sammi to the podcast to tell her story. Sammi is freshly out of the church and still navigating what her life will look like from here on out. They discuss family relationships and how they change once you leave the church, finding a support system, and coffee (of course). We are sure you're going to love Sammi!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 77. Give'r: The Good Girl Syndrome
episodes.description: This week, Jake and Dusti talk about sex! But through the lens of a popular Mormon sexual intimacy book called And They Were Not Ashamed by Dr. Laura Brotherson, and yes it's as cringey as it sounds. Complete with some very questionable Canadian slang, this one is not for the faint of heart. Also, they barely skimmed the surface of the book, so there will be more from this in the future!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 76. The Satanists of Mormonism
episodes.description: This week is a special treat! Jake and Dusti invite special guests Brittany and Mags to the podcast. Brittany is a pastor and Mags is a historian for the Community of Christ Church. They are here this week to offer clarity and insight into the church. If you recall, Jake and Dusti covered the Community of Christ church a few episodes ago. It was a fun and interesting chat with Brittany and Mags!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: In a Poncho Being Touched by Old People
episodes.description: This week, Jake and Dusti discuss the changes to the temple ceremony. They get their information from an anonymous poster who describes in detail what changed and how it made them feel.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: TK Smoothies
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake welcome back special guest Kadey, from Not So Molly Mormon podcast, to rage over a BYU Devotional given by Kevin S Hamilton on January 24, 2023. He talks about covenants (fun drinking game: take a shot whenever he says the word "covenant." Actually don't; you might die), the need for a church and organized religion, and quotes the Book of Mormon A LOT. What is a TK Smoothie you ask? You'll have to listen to find out!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Ew, David! Don't Masturbate!
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti talk about a youth broadcast hosted by Gerrit Gong, Bonnie Cordon, and Steven Lund. This performative devotional was where they presented the 2023 youth theme: I Can Do All Things Through Christ. A Mormon analogy wouldn't be complete without some good ol' cultural appropriation as Elder Dong talks about spiritual trail markers. Enjoy!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Personal Progress isn't Personal
episodes.description: This week, Dusti dusts off her Personal Progress book to share with Jake. If you, listener, were in Young Women's this episode might trigger you and you might find yourself reciting the theme along with Dusti. That's what brainwashing and conditioning will do to you!
subjects: Cult Psychology

episodes.title: Emma's Church
episodes.description: Women with the priesthood? LGBTQ inclusivity? No forced baptisms? No weird temple ceremonies? Book of Mormon not viewed as the main scripture? Could it be that the Restored LDS church has more things right than the mainstream church? Jake tells Dusti all about the RLDS aka The Community of Christ Church and you'll be surprised how not half-bad it is.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Your Mission Handbook has a Beard?!
episodes.description: Get ready because this week we are diving into the mission handbook that tells missionaries literally everything they can and cannot do on their missions. It's a guidebook they carry around in their pockets for the entire duration of their missions. Dusti and Jake welcome special guest Stephen (exmormon_rhetoric on Instagram) as they go through the handbook. Note: this is the 2002 edition of the handbook and not the updated 2019 version.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Ditch Jeff!
episodes.description: For our 69th episode (Niiiice), Jake welcomes special guest co-host Kadey from Not So Molly Mormon podcast. At the beginning of January, Jeffrey Holland and his wife Patricia spoke to youth of the church at a conference, and Jake reads highlights to Kadey of what was said. Don't worry, listeners, Dusti will be back!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Weak Little Arms
episodes.description: Jake reads an article from Deseret News to Dusti. The article talks about how language is being corrupted to the point where gender is being confused and the role of a woman is muddied. As you can imagine, it's extremely problematic. TW: anti-transgender stuff that might be sensitive to some listeners.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Want Some Aloe for that Sick Burn?
episodes.description: Jake tells Dusti all about D. Gary Young and Young Living Essential Oils which is all the rage in Utah and among a lot of Mormons. This MLM has a very problematic past with a very controversial founder (sound familiar?). TW: infant death
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
Young Living
Multi-Level Marketing

episodes.title: Not the Fingies!
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti welcome special guest Kadey (from Not So Molly Mormon podcast). This week they let you in on their book club where Jake and Dusti tell Kadey all about Black Widows by Cate Quinn: a murder mystery set in Utah where the victim is a polygamist and the prime suspects are his three wives. This one is a wild ride! TW: infant death, sexual abuse and assault
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Tithing Declaration...No Thank You!
episodes.description: It's that time of year! Tithing settlement time! Oh wait, it's called tithing declaration now. So many PR spins with the church lately, it's hard to keep up. Jake and Dusti talk about tithing declaration, BYU, and how two lesbians saved the day on Jake's mission. Listen for free wherever you listen to podcasts (ten percent not required)!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Anxious Grizzly Bear
episodes.description: You know what's missing from your exmo holiday? Advice about anxiety and depression from a Mormon doctor! Well, Jake and Dusti got you covered. Listen as Jake reads an article from LDS Living to Dusti (self-proclaimed anxiety-ridden mama grizzly bear) and get some helpful (and some not-so-helpful) tips to get through depression and anxiety. Disclaimer: Jake and Dusti are speaking from their own experiences and not as professionals. Seek the guidance of a licensed therapist for professional advice.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: See Ya Next Tuesday: Activism Towards the Church
episodes.description: Hey, it's the ATC, yeah you know me! This episode is from a talk given by Ahmad S. Corbitt from the Young Men's General Presidency. Jake reads highlights from the talk to Dusti. Listen as Corbitt explains the dangers of activism towards the church (ATC) and basically doubles down on the fear-mongering to the church's members about any thinking or action that is outside of the box.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: I'm Just a Loophole, Sir
episodes.description: Dusti covers an episode from Fifth Estate, a Canadian investigative journalism show. She tells Jake all about how the Mormon church uses a loophole to funnel Canadian money into BYU. And that's just the beginning of it!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Sin Saturated Pleasures of the Flesh: General Conference Pt 2
episodes.description: This is the second round of general conference talks! Dusti and Jake are joined with special guest Kadey from Not So Molly Mormon podcast to bring you three more highlights from October 2022's general conference. If you missed the first part (we understand; we had technical difficulties) be sure to listen to that part before diving into this one.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Sin Saturated Pleasures of the Flesh: October Conference Pt 1
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake welcome special guest Kadey from Not So Molly Mormon podcast to talk about the October 2022 General Conference. For the entirety of their coverage they each covered two talks. This first portion has the first round of those talks. This is a mega episode. We listened and read so you wouldn't have to!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Spooky Season with the Mormons
episodes.description: Spooky season is upon us and Dusti and Jake are here to add to it! Jake tells Dusti about the church's stance on Halloween, Dusti tells Jake the history of Halloween, and by the end they're talking books and movies that are sure to give you the creeps. Have a safe and happy Halloween! If you have any scary movies or book recommendations, reach out to Jake and Dusti on Instagram or Gmail. Rate review and subscribe!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Satanic Panic
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake welcome special guest Kadey from Not So Molly Mormon podcast to discuss Satanic Panic. Dusti gives the background on Satanic Panic and Kadey tells about how one pre-school mother's accusations ruined the lives of several people falsely accused of being involved in cults and abusing children. At the end they digress and talk about horror movies, weird Mormon beliefs about the occult and Satan, patriarchal blessings, Bloody Mary, and Ouija boards. It's ok, Dusti, Sam and Dean killed Bloody Mary. Happy Spooky Season, besties!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: I Can't F**k a Carl
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake discuss the new updates to the For the Strength of Youth pamphlet that were announced at the October 2022 General Conference by Elder Uchtdorf. The main topics changed were dating, dress and appearance, tattoos and piercings, and homosexuality. Listen and find out why a majority of the exMormon community is raging about these changes.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 56. Sins of Our Mother: Lori Vallow Pt 2
episodes.description: In this conclusion to a two-part series, Jake and Dusti continue talking about Lori Vallow and the Netflix documentary Sins of Our Mother. If you haven't listened to the first half of this, you will want to go back and listen so you catch all the crazy details of this Mormon mom who killed her children and is responsible for the deaths of at least two other people. Spooky season is upon us and Dusti and Jake are here to help ring it in!
subjects: Chad Daybell

episodes.title: 55. Sins of Our Mother: Lori Vallow Pt 1
episodes.description: This week, settle in as Dusti and Jake gear up for spooky season and respond to Netflix's documentary Sins of Our Mother. It's the insane story of Lori Vallow, a seemingly perfect, righteous Mormon mom who became radicalized to the point of murder. Enjoy part 1 this week and come back for the conclusion next week!
subjects: Chad Daybell

episodes.title: Superiority Complex: Dallin H Oaks' BYU Devotional
episodes.description: Dusti and Jake cover the BYU devotional given by Dallin Homophobe Oaks. His talk is filled with misogyny and anti-feminism as you can imagine. He also doubles down on the anti-LGBTQ talk given by Jeffrey Holland last year. So buckle in and get ready to rage with Dusti and Jake!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Teal Swan's Comma Eyebrows Pt 2
episodes.description: In the conclusion of the two-part series, Dusti and Kadey, from Not So Molly Mormon podcast, tell Jake more about Teal Swan's wild shenanigans. The discussion is centered around the documentary The Deep End. TW: mentions of suicide.
subjects: Teal Swan

episodes.title: Teal Swan's Comma Eyebrows Pt 1
episodes.description: In Part One of a two-part series, Dusti and special guest Kadey (from Not So Molly Mormon, tell Jake all about new-age spiritualist cult leader, Teal Swan. She's intense and so very problematic. For this part, they discuss Teal's background and then start with the documentary The Deep End episode by episode. TW: abuse and mentions of suicide.
subjects: Teal Swan

episodes.title: How the Church Protects Itself Not Victims of Abuse
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti cover that viral article published by AP News that exposed how the church protects predators by not mandating its leaders to report abuse. Trigger warnings: sex abuse, child abuse, suicide. This one is a heavy one, besties, so listen when you have the mental and emotional bandwidth for it.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Minisode: When Dad Came Out as Gay
episodes.description: It's a Not So Peter Priesthood Minisode! Jake reads a heartbreaking email from a listener who tells about their feelings when their very LDS father came out as gay.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Slutty Olive Oil
episodes.description: This week is all about women! Jake is joined with Dusti and special guest, Kadey from Not So Molly Mormon podcast to talk about women and the priesthood. Jake gives a history lesson and Kadey talks all about Ordain Women and the audacity of women trying to wear pants to church.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: The Guide to Not Obeying the Word of Wisdom
episodes.description: Growing up Mormon, you obviously don't learn anything about coffee and alcohol other than that it is evil. So, of course, when you leave the church and go to try coffee or alcohol it's going to be super awkward and hard to know what to get. Dusti imparts her wisdom about coffee to help you know what makes a latte different from a mocha. Jake and Dusti also talk about alcoholic beverages. This episode is to help you learn more about the forbidden drinks! You'll enjoy it even if you already know about it!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Another Douchebag Who Thinks He's a Prophet
episodes.description: The fun continues as Jake tells Dusti about the Third Convention. Ya know...that time when Mexican Mormons wanted a Mexican mission president and the church denied them three times so they branched off and got excommunicated. And then a guy named Margarito Bautista started his own off-shoot.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: You Down with AUB Yeah You Know Me
episodes.description: In a continuation of the rabbit holes Jake went down, this episode covers the Apostolic United Brethren church. Jake and Dusti discover that this offshoot of the Mormon church thinks that Mormons are the heathens. They also read a blog written by someone who visited the church and, of course, they cover the TLC series Sister Wives.
subjects: Apostolic United Brethren

episodes.title: Ervil LeBaron and the 4 O Clock Murders Part Two
episodes.description: If you have not listened to part one of this two-part episode, go back and listen! This is the second half of the epic collaboration with Dusti, Sara, and Kadey. Jake continues to tell all about the Mormon Manson, Ervil LeBaron, and all the murders he orchestrated. Most of the information from this episode and part one can be found in Scott Anderson's book The 4 O'Clock Murders: The True Story of a Mormon Family's Vengeance.
subjects: Church of the First Born of the Lamb of God

episodes.title: Ervil LeBaron and the 4 O Clock Murders Part One
episodes.description: In this epic collaboration, Jake is joined with three special co-hosts: Dusti, and Sara and Kadey from Not So Molly Mormon podcast! Jake tells the ladies about the Mormon Manson, Ervil LeBaron, who orchestrated the murders of several of his own family members and never lifted a finger to do it himself. Not So Molly Mormon also covered this story on their podcast. The two complement each other very well so if you want more, go listen to Episode 131 on their podcast. This is a two-parter, so you'll have to wait til next week to get the rest of the juicy details. TW: graphic descriptions of murder.
subjects: Church of the First Born of the Lamb of God

episodes.title: Playing Kinderhooky
episodes.description: This episode is the beginning of a series brought to you by Jake. At the beginning of this little journey, Jake tells Dusti about a hoax played on Joseph Smith: the Kinderhook plates. They were fabricated plates meant to catch J Dawg for the scam artist he was. This is only the beginning of the rabbit holes Jake will take you down in the weeks to come.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Hi Gay!
episodes.description: For the end of Pride month, Jake and Dusti read an article from LDS Living written by a Mormon mom giving advice on what to say when a family member comes out as gay. It's every bit as cringy as you'd expect.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: ExMormon Rhetoric
episodes.description: This week's special guest is Stephen (aka @exmormon_rhetoric). Jake and Stephen both have military backgrounds. Stephen's story and circumstance is different in that his wife and kids are still active in the church while he has left. Listen to how he has found ways to cope as he continues to deconstruct while maintaining a healthy relationship with his family. They get a bit spiritual and a few tangents ensue. This one is a longer episode, but it is well worth it! Enjoy!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Actual Agency
episodes.description: Jake's guest on this week's episode is Shirelle (@actual_agency). Shirelle tells her story about being a Mormon woman who followed the formula and ultimately left the church. She talks about the pressures of every day life as a Mormon woman, how leaving has affected her relationships with her family and with herself, and what agency actually means to her.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Pride Month: Being an Ally
episodes.description: June is Pride Month for the LGBTQ+ community, and Jake and Dusti are here to talk all about it. They discuss some of the history of Pride and what makes a good ally for members of the queer community. Hopefully this episode will help you understand why we have Pride and learn a bit about how you can be a better ally.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: FOMO (On Deez Nuts)
episodes.description: Jake is joined again with Kadey, one-half of the Not So Molly Mormon podcast. They read a talk that was given by Rusty Nelson about FOMO and, essentially, Mormon exceptionalism. This talk was so ridiculous both Jake and Kadey, as well as a few listeners, were stunned that it was not satire. Evolution and the plan of salvation (barf) are discussed at length. Enjoy!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: The Cool Kids
episodes.description: Jake and Dusti discuss the cliques and "cool kids" in the exMo community. They also discuss the susceptibility of exams to fall for charismatic leaders and toxic, structured communities. Digressions include: cringey Mormon missionary TikToks, tattoos that bring the wrath of Sky Daddy, and a brief discussion about segregation in the church. Jake gets a bit tipsy and there are some technical difficulties, but stick around because it is worth it!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Swipe Up for Jesus
episodes.description: Not So Peter Priesthood is back with special guest Dusti. Jake and his emotional support Canadian talk about the Mormon dating app, Mutual. They share reviews, terrible church-oriented pick-up lines, myths about the app, and online dating stories. There are a few tangents but mostly just a lot of laughing.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Mormon Porn & Release Valves
episodes.description: On this week's episode, Jake and Dusti talk all about pornography, specifically Mormon pornography. Not only do they talk about the fetishizing of Mormons in porn, but also how the leaders of the church demonize pornography. Things obviously get a little raunchy and end with a lovely quote from Boyd K Packer. Digressions include Paul Walker and, naturally, masturbation. The underlying theme is that everyone needs therapy. Go release your valves after you've listened to this episode!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Oaky Afterbirth
episodes.description: Jake welcomes Kadey from Not So Molly Mormon podcast back to the show and tells her all about A Study in Scarlet by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. The first story of Sherlock Holmes featured Mormons during Brigham Young's time. Because of the way Doyle portrayed Mormons, this story has been banned and hated by them. Could it be that Sir Arthur Conan Doyle got it right?
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Highwater: A Special Interview with Irene's Entropy
episodes.description: This week's episode drops early for very special reasons. For this episode, Jake sits with Irene from Irene's Entropy. April 12 is her freedom day, the day she received a letter telling her that her records had been removed from the church, and thus the beginning of her new life. Irene's Entropy has also released an album on April 12 which is available on her website and will be available for streaming in the future. This conversation is sure to stick with you as it has for Jake in the days since recording. Irene is a beautiful soul and you can hear it in her insights, her music, and the way she tells her story. TW: sexual abuse, sexual assault, child abuse.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Your Body Belongs to You
episodes.description: In this episode, Jake and Dusti tackle purity culture in the Mormon religion. Jake actually does research but quickly finds he should have at least read the whole article before recording. They talk tattoos, sex, how purity culture affects men as well as women, and, of course, other tangents ensue. This one is a doozy you won't want to miss!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
Purity Culture

episodes.title: Special Lady Friends
episodes.description: Take a dive into queer Mormon history with Jake and Dusti as they discuss the lives of Louie B. Felt and May Anderson. These women served as the first general primary presidents and founded The Friend Magazine. History remembers them as really close friends, but it is obvious their love was deeper than that. Tangents and digressions include: book recommendations corner, 1-900 numbers, The Little Mermaid, condoms, and friends that are practically family.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Morning Glory Milking Farm
episodes.description: Michelle is a never-Mormon, but her story is very relatable. Listen as she tells Jake about her religious experiences. Michelle recounts ostracism from religion as a kid, her attempt to return to religion and how it backfired wildly, and what led her to ultimately be an atheist. This one gets insane! There's a huge digression at the end about blue alien barbarian smut. TW: suicide mentioned briefly.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Girl, Interrupted and Converted
episodes.description: On this week's episode, Jake talks to Meg who tells her story about being sent to a facility in Utah, converted to Mormonism, and what eventually led her to leave the church. Meg's story is pretty wild and intense. Trigger Warnings: sexual assault, suicide/suicidal ideations, mental health.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Oh How Molly Mormon of You
episodes.description: Jake welcomes Brianna as his guest on the show this week. Listen to Brianna's story as she tells about her mission, coming home and getting married right away, and how Law & Order: SVU provided an awakening in regards to her past trauma. Trigger Warning: sexual assault.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Intent Does Not Override Impact
episodes.description: This week's episode is a special treat as Jake invites an anonymous guest to talk about her experiences working at BYU during the aftermath of Jeffery R Holland's musket fire speech. The anniversary of that speech is approaching so what is it really like at BYU these days? Hear it straight from the source!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Take Several Seats, Brad
episodes.description: The now infamous talk given by Brad Wilcox at a tri-stake youth conference earlier this month gets the Not So Peter Priesthood treatment as Jake tells Dusti all about it. This talk is problematic from start to finish. If you have not listened to it, you might not even have to or want to after you listen to this episode. Remember to rate, review, and subscribe! Enjoy!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Namaste B*tches
episodes.description: Dusti returns to tell Jake all about her experience as a yoga student and instructor and how the yoga industry is cult-like. The similarities to the church are astounding. Some of the digressions get very Canadian (humor vs. humour). Jake also reads an article about warning signs that your latest fad diet might be a cult. Get into downward dog and take a deep breath or two as you listen to this latest episode!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Holy Jake
episodes.description: This week, Jake talks with one of two Holy Sisters! Kerry, from Holy Sisters podcast, shares her story of leaving the church. She and Jake share stories and experiences from their missions. Kerry's story is complicated because she began questioning the church while married to her seminary teacher husband. You'll be sure to enjoy this chat! Be sure to check out Kerry and her sister, Heidi's, podcast, Holy Sisters!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: This Rod Has a Curve in It
episodes.description: Get ready for all the jokes about male genitalia in this latest episode where Jake and Dusti discuss Lehi's Vision of the Iron Rod and the Tree of Life. Digressions and rants ensue, as is expected, as well as many a penis joke. The only regret is that shaft was never mentioned once in the episode. Missed opportunity! Giggle like a schoolgirl along with Jake and Dusti!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Minisode: Not Hate Mail
episodes.description: Jake reads an email from a listener who tells their story of leaving the church which includes a discussion about modesty with a bishop. The listener tells how therapy helped them leave an abusive marriage and, eventually, the church. TW: mentions rape/sexual assault.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Minisode: Advice for LGBTQ+ in the Church
episodes.description: On Jake's first minisode, he gives advice to a listener who wrote in asking how to deal with being LGBTQ+ and being in the church.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Justice for Satan
episodes.description: Jake is back! After huge apologies for being MIA for a month, Jake welcomes Dusti back as his guest on this episode where they discuss free agency and how Satan is used as a tool to manipulate members of the church. Also, enjoy the new segment of the show: Fun with Mormons (still workshopping the title). Enjoy the squeaky dog toy in the background and scream into the void with Jake and Dusti!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: The Frozen Chosen
episodes.description: For this episode, Jake and Kristy discuss the quirks of being a student at BYU and BYU-Idaho. Buckle in as they discuss weird dates, technology of the early 2000s, MRS Degrees, skouching, deer humping, and this strange thing called gazing. This episode is more light-hearted and fun, just in time for the holidays.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Soaking the Market: An Interview with Latter Day Cafe
episodes.description: This week's episode is piping hot! In an exclusive interview with one of the founders of Latter Day Cafe, Michael Draper, Jake and Dusti ask the questions we've all been wanting to ask. Michael debunks some issues from the article that was read in episode 17 (listen to that episode to understand this episode more fully). Digressions include: soaking, holiday traditions, Rick and Morty, and puppies. Grab a cup of coffee, or coffee-less coffee, get cozy, and listen!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Into the Thicc of Sh*t
episodes.description: Dusti returns and the turns have tabled as she asks Jake questions about a new update in his life. Hint: Jake is not in Kansas anymore, Toto! Digressions include: flat-earthers and preppers, dog names, and some titillating story about Jake pointing at Germany on a map. As a cherry on top of this conversation, Jake and Dusti discuss a new cafe, Latter-Day Cafe, that sells a coffee substitute in Provo. Grab your quads, brothers and sisters, this episode will have you laughing and crying and maybe even cry-laughing! Rate, review, subscribe to support the show!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Live, Laugh, Apostatize: Kristy's Story
episodes.description: Kristy, on Instagram as live.laugh.apostatize, returns for part two to tell her story and how she's currently deconstructing what made her leave the church 15 years ago. Her journey takes us from being a questioning Mormon at BYU to being an exMormon at Auburn trying to find a place to fit in. Listen to part one to understand the references to attachment. Digressions include: a Thanksgiving story, White Russians, discourses of Brigham Young, racism, and finding connections as an exMormon. Rate, review, subscribe! Enjoy!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Attachment Trauma: When God's Love is Conditional
episodes.description: This week's episode, Jake chats with Kristy, a therapist who is currently working on deconstructing her Mormon background and faith. This is the first part in a two-part discussion. For this first portion, Kristy tells Jake about attachment styles and how that plays into leaving core beliefs, faith, and our relationships with God. Digressions include: BYU-Idaho, equal rights, and boundaries. Grab a cup of coffee or tea, sit back and enjoy this conversation!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Bullsh*t at the Pulpit
episodes.description: Jake and guest, Karly, go over some talks from the leaders of the church who spoke at General Conference October 2021. Karly returns from the first episode. Digressions include: Deseret Book, segregation in the church, and crying in church. Prepare yourself for the latest in the bs that is being said over the pulpit!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: 13: We are Never Ever Getting Back Together Pt 2
episodes.description: Enjoy part two of last week's episode with Becky! The conversation about narcissism and hypocrisy in the church continues with many a tangent as per usual.
subjects: Psychology

episodes.title: 12: We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together Pt 1
episodes.description: For this episode, Jake is joined by Becky, a mother of five who stepped away from the church because actions and doctrines didn't add up. They also talk meditation, ways to feel grounded, purity culture and how it effects both women and men, the reality of prayer, and seeing the Mormon culture behind the facade of perfection, and so much more. This is the first part in a two-part episode. You'll have to stay tuned next week for the rest of this fun conversation with a beautiful soul.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
Purity Culture

episodes.title: Episode 11: You Can't Sit With Us
episodes.description: Dusti returns to tell all about a denial to her resignation from the church HQ. This is mostly a venting session as both Jake and Dusti are enraged over this news. Sip your coffee and listen to the digressions which include: Mean Girls, a bit of politics, covid, social media, and transparency. Resignation is hard, and the church is making it harder and it's abusive! TW: domestic abuse, stalking.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 10: Don't Be a Dick
episodes.description: On this week's episode, Jake joins a former missionary buddy, Eric, who has also stepped away from the church. They reminisce old mission stories; Jake confesses Eric's daddy status. Eric then tells what led him to leave and explains his new life philosophy. Of course there are many tangents and digressions along the way. Grab some whiskey and enjoy this chat among former elders!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 9: MelchizeDICK Priesthood
episodes.description: Episode 9: Jake is joined again by the lovely Dusti to talk more about the priesthood! On this week's episode, Jake and Dusti discuss the Melchizedek priesthood with plenty of tangents and sidebars because that's how it be sometimes. You can share your stories with Jake at notsopeterpriesthood@gmail.com!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 8: Do Ask, Do Tell
episodes.description: On this week's episode, Jake is joined by two incredible humans who both served under Don't Ask Don't Tell (DADT). This is a bit of a deviation from the norm, but the 10th anniversary of DADT was on Monday September 20 and it's a monumental occasion to look back on how far the military has come since then. Guests Ann and Dena share their experiences in founding the only military-sanctioned LGBTQ+ group for sailors to go to for support and resources. It was an honor to be a part of this conversation and you are sure to enjoy these two guests!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 7: Hail Thyself!
episodes.description: This week's episode, Jake joins guest co-host, Lindsay, to discuss her journey since she and her family very publicly left the church. They talk about BYU-Idaho scandals, the Satanic Temple, the audacity of some church leaders, as well as self-discovery and advocacy. You are sure to adore Lindsay! You can find her on TikTok at socialistlyawkard! Email the show: notsopeterpriesthood@gmail.com
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 6: Aint No Hood like the Priesthood
episodes.description: On this episode, Jake is joined again with guest co-host Dusti! Get ready for the first of many episodes on the topic of the priesthood. Jake and Dusti mostly discuss the Aaronic Priesthood and the restoration. Buckle in for a ton of tangents and digressions which include: Mariah Carey, vaccines, dreams, bad dates, drunk stories, and the occasional dog interruptions. TW: abortion, religious phrases, sexual assault, and retail during Christmas.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 5: Muskets and Mayhem
episodes.description: For this week's episode Jake joins the insatiable and gorgeous hosts of Not So Molly Mormon Podcast, Sara and Kadey! They answer questions from listeners and then discuss that speech given by the mighty-jowled Jeffrey R. Holland at BYU last week. This was recorded the day after that speech was given. Since then a lot has happened and many in the exMo and LGBTQ+ community have spoken out about it. Also note: this episode will also be available on Patreon for Patrons of Not So Molly Mormon podcast. You can see all of our lovely faces!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 4: Being Queer and Mormon
episodes.description: On this episode, Jake is joined with guest co-host, Di, to discuss growing up queer in the LDS church. Di (they/them) explains the difficulties of navigating being Latinx, Mormon, nonbinary, and pansexual. Digressions include: a barking dog, pronouns, and drag queen shows.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 3: Lighting the Fire
episodes.description: On this episode, Jake is joined by guest co-host, Dusti. With their powers combine, they try to take down the patriarchy. Dusti tells of three pivotal moments in her life that lit the fire that would eventually bring her to leave the church. Digressions include: baby Hitler, Stevie Nicks (of course), land lines, seminary teachers, and seasonal depression. Trigger warnings: mental health, depression, anxiety, suicide, and abortion.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 2: And It Came to Yasss
episodes.description: Jake is flying solo today. On the second episode, Jake introduces you to the podcast and tells you a bit about his life and the events that led him to leave the church.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Episode 1: Masturbating in the Missionary Mall
episodes.description: Jake discusses really light topics for the first episode, namely: masturbation, premarital sex, porn, and sexual assault. Gotta keep it real. Guest co-host Karly tells her experiences with a Not So Peter Priesthood. Trigger warning: rape, sexual assault.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
